alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee; Ozaukee; Sheboygan; Washington; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:39PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ozaukee, Milwaukee, northeastern Waukesha, eastern Washington and central Sheboygan Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 239 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Kohler to New Berlin. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Milwaukee, West Allis, Sheboygan, Wauwatosa, New Berlin, Brookfield, Greenfield, Menomonee Falls, Oak Creek, Muskego, Mequon, South Milwaukee, Cudahy, Whitefish Bay, Greendale, Brown Deer, Grafton, Cedarburg, Port Washington, and St. Francis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 between mile markers 299 and 310. Interstate 43 between mile markers 53 and 61, and between mile markers 73 and 131. Interstate 41 between mile markers 40 and 53. Interstate 41/894 between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 41/43/894 between mile markers 5 and 9. Interstate 43/94 between mile markers 311 and 316. Interstate 41/94 between mile markers 317 and 320. Interstate 794 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
